hook.text: Liberalism is so common in the West that most people don't even realize they're liberals.

buildup.text: It began with Locke and Mill: individual rights, limited government, rule of law, free markets.

discovery.text: Liberalism says every person has inherent dignity and freedom. The state exists to protect those.

twist.text: But liberalism struggles with inequality. Freedom without resources is empty. Markets create winners and losers.

climax.text: Modern liberalism split: classical liberals want less government; social liberals want more â€” to equalize opportunity.

punchline.text: Freedom for all sounds simple. Implementing it never is.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of liberalism?
